column4: hey, what would be the easiest way to steam audio from my linux box to a mac?
is there an easy way?
I ended up just using samba
that would work yes, can you assign different 'profiles' in iTunes. I wouldnt want to scare my roomate with new music
you can't use random programs, but you can use SA
random programs, it's evolution for crying out loud. and it's been supported in previous versions
using any arbitrary program as a filter was supported in warty?
according to Guerin he configured it using evolution 2.03
spamassassin?  yes, that is supported fine.
I cant seem to get evolution 2.2.1.1 to send messages to spamd or clamd
I think you're mixing up what I said
evolution can use spamassassin just fine, afaik, but you can't configure it to use any random program you like
Alright so right now with spamd running evolution is filtering messages without any addidional configuration?
as far as I know, it doesn't use spamd at all
::confused:: so evolution uses spamassassin without spamd?
as far as I know, yes
remember, spamassassin is also just a command line program
spamd is just an optimisation so perl doesn't have to start up all the time
right. thanks. I guess i'm justnot used to things 'just work'ing in linux yet =)
say it is'nt so
using backports at this point is silly
i thought it was oo-boon-too.
well, it's not the same "boon" as the word boon
